framedata.cancel: N SP J IC R SB

properties: Shiori does a short punch to the opponent's torso.

framedata.cancel: N SP JH IC f5B/2B SB

properties: Shiori kicks her foot high, creating a bladed arc of ice in its wake.

Shiori whips her now-frozen shawl directly out in front of her, reaching 1/3 of the screen. This move is probably Shiori's best poke due to its range and speed. However, at this move's maximum range, it cannot be comboed into the Strong attacks since they do not extend far enough.
Shiori whips her now-frozen shawl directly out in front of her, reaching 1/3 of the screen.
This move is probably Shiori's best poke due to its range and speed. However, at this move's maximum range, it cannot be comboed into the Strong attacks since they do not extend far enough.

Shiori generates a mid-sized shard of ice from the ground, pointing diagonally up-forwards. This move will launch the opponent and becomes jump-cancellable if it hits. This move is Shiori's primary method to launch her opponent and use her powerful air combos. During active, this move will alternate between the two hitboxes every 2 frames.
Shiori generates a mid-sized shard of ice from the ground, pointing diagonally up-forwards. This move will launch the opponent and becomes jump-cancellable if it hits.
This move is Shiori's primary method to launch her opponent and use her powerful air combos.
During active, this move will alternate between the two hitboxes every 2 frames.

framedata.cancel: N SP J IC R SB

properties: Shiori does a short punch to the opponent's torso from her crouching state. This move is pretty weak for a 2A, and it does not even hit low!
Shiori does a short punch to the opponent's torso from her crouching state.
This move is pretty weak for a 2A, and it does not even hit low!

Shiori does a short punch to the opponent's knees. This move is Shiori's fastest low attack. It cannot be comboed into any other B attacks, so it will not be as easy to hit-confirm Shiori's high-low mixup game compared to other characters.
Shiori does a short punch to the opponent's knees.
This move is Shiori's fastest low attack. It cannot be comboed into any other B attacks, so it will not be as easy to hit-confirm Shiori's high-low mixup game compared to other characters.
Shiori does a low sweep kick, with a blade of ice on her foot to increase her range. This move will barely launch the opponent.

framedata.cancel: N SP J AD IC R

properties: Shiori flicks her shawl out diagonally down-forwards a short distance.
Shiori creates a straight blade of ice from her hand, pointing diagonally down-forward.
Shiori creates a chainsaw of ice from her foot, pointing diagonally down-forward. It hits 3 times, each hit does the same amount, and can be cancelled in-between hits.
Dashing version of 5A.
Dashing version of c5B.
Shiori does a short running hop and slams her shawl on top of the opponent's head. This move acts as an overhead, and will knock down the opponent if it hits.
Shiori does a short punch to the opponent's torso from her crouching state. Even less useful than her regular 2A since it is a typical dash attack and can only be cancelled into specials.
Shiori does a short punch to the opponent's torso from her crouching state.
Even less useful than her regular 2A since it is a typical dash attack and can only be cancelled into specials.
Shiori does a short punch to the opponent's knees.
Shiori does a low sweep kick, with a blade of ice on her foot to increase her range. This move will barely launch the opponent.

Shiori hugs the opponent, who then goes into a frozen state and is launched high and slightly forward before landing in a knockdown state. This move is a pretty useful throw in the corner, because it is possible for Shiori to combo while the opponent is still frozen.
Shiori hugs the opponent, who then goes into a frozen state and is launched high and slightly forward before landing in a knockdown state.
This move is a pretty useful throw in the corner, because it is possible for Shiori to combo while the opponent is still frozen.

variations.notes: Shiori hugs the opponent, who then goes into a frozen state and is launched high and slightly forward before landing in a knockdown state. This move is a pretty useful throw in the corner, because it is possible for Shiori to combo while the opponent is still frozen.

Shiori hugs the opponent, who then goes into a frozen state and is launched high and slightly forward before landing in a knockdown state. This move is a pretty useful throw in the corner, because it is possible for Shiori to combo while the opponent is still frozen.

Shiori hugs the opponent, who then goes into a frozen state and is launched high and slightly forward before landing in a knockdown state. This move is a pretty useful throw in the corner, because it is possible for Shiori to combo while the opponent is still frozen.

properties: Shiori hugs the opponent, who then goes into a frozen state and is launched high and slightly forward before landing in a knockdown state.

moves.moveName: A sure way to win snowball fights
properties: Shiori poses for a half-second, and then generates a circular shield around her which makes her completely immune to almost all projectile attacks. The shield lasts for 310.33 frames (about 5 seconds) before fading. The shield can only absorb one projectile per frame so some supers (noted below) can pass through it and hit Shiori when most of their projectiles should not be able to. Projectiles disabled by the shield do not become active again when the shield ends. Reference the table below to see which projeciles this makes Shiori immune to.

Shiori poses for a half-second, and then generates a circular shield around her which makes her completely immune to almost all projectile attacks. The shield lasts for 310.33 frames (about 5 seconds) before fading. The shield can only absorb one projectile per frame so some supers (noted below) can pass through it and hit Shiori when most of their projectiles should not be able to. Projectiles disabled by the shield do not become active again when the shield ends.
Shiori shoots an instant-hit beam straight across the entire screen.
All versions shoot three beams that will freeze the opponent if they hit.
A version has fast startup but poor recovery, B has slower startup but better recovery.
C version causes a special frozen state that enables combo follow-ups.
Aerial versions maintain the beam parallel to Shiori's jump arc.
If used in air, Shiori will hover at ground level with the same momentum until recovery.

variations.notes: Fast startup 3-hit beam with poor recovery. Freezes opponent briefly on hit, giving time for IC follow-ups but not for normal combos.
Delayed startup but better recovery. Much safer on block than A version (-7 vs -23). Good for zoning at a distance.
Places opponent in a special frozen state that allows for direct combo follow-ups. Can lead to combos even after the ice block hits the ground. No FIC available.
Same properties as ground versions but beam stays parallel to jump arc. Shiori will hover at ground level if she reaches ground before recovery ends.

properties: Shiori summons a snowman that performs different actions based on button pressed.
A version makes the snowman float around Shiori before punching three times.
B version makes the snowman fire an ice beam that freezes opponents for combo follow-ups.
C version creates a large circular freeze zone about 1/3 screen away from Shiori.
Aerial version has the snowman stay where it was created rather than following Shiori.

variations.notes: Snowman floats around Shiori for about 2 seconds before punching toward the opponent 3 times. Good for okizeme and pressure.
Snowman fires a thin instant-hit ice beam that places opponent in a special frozen state. Allows for combo follow-ups even after the ice block hits the ground.
Snowman moves about 1/3 screen forward and creates a large circular freeze zone. Can be FIC'd using 214 2C, though there's rarely a reason to do so.

properties: Shiori spins her shawl in a large circle in front of her, hitting multiple times.
All versions will launch the opponent if they hit, but generally require IC to follow up.
Frame advantage on block varies widely based on which hits connect.
A version hits up to 5 times, B version up to 9 times, and C version up to 18 times.
C version has startup invincibility and serves as Shiori's main reversal.

variations.notes: Spins shawl for up to 5 hits. Launch property makes it useful as an anti-air or combo starter with IC. Block advantage varies greatly depending on which hits connect.
Spins shawl for up to 9 hits. Longer active frames and higher damage than A version, but with increased recovery. Similar applications requiring IC to convert.
Has startup invincibility and knocks down on hit. Shiori's main reversal option, though not the strongest. 18 potential hits with IC cancel gives good damage potential.

properties: Shiori raises her hand out toward the sky, and a large block of ice falls from above (A: close, B: middle, C: far). This move will knock down the opponent if it hits.

moves.moveName: This is sharper than I thought
properties: Shiori throws ice-boxcutters in a straight line diagonally down-forwards.
All versions are plus on block, making them excellent pressure tools.
A version throws two boxcutters with quick startup.
B version has delayed startup but better frame advantage.
C version has startup invincibility and each boxcutter hits multiple times for more damage.

variations.notes: Throws two ice-boxcutters diagonally downward. Quick startup and plus on block makes this excellent for pressure, especially when combined with FIC.
Delayed startup but higher frame advantage on block (+4~+6). Useful for altering timing in pressure strings or safe jump setups.
Has startup invincibility and each boxcutter hits 4 times. Most advantageous on block (+5~+10) and deals the most damage, making it Shiori's best aerial pressure tool.

properties: Shiori rapidly fires cartons of ice cream across a wide angle in front of her.
Best position is point-blank range in the air slightly above opponent.
A version fires 15 cartons, B version fires 27 cartons, C version fires 50 cartons.
Higher versions have more projectiles but also significantly longer recovery.
Not all projectiles will hit even at optimal positioning due to their spread pattern.

variations.notes: Fires 15 ice cream cartons in a wide spread. At optimal positioning (point-blank, slightly above opponent), all 15 can connect for good damage with the least recovery of all versions.
Fires 27 ice cream cartons, though on average only about 24 will connect even at optimal positioning. Higher damage potential but substantially longer recovery.
Fires 50 ice cream cartons, though only about 35 typically connect. Highest potential damage but extremely punishable due to the very long recovery time.

properties: Shiori creates ice spikes from the ground across the screen in front of her.
All versions place the opponent in a special frozen state that allows for direct combos.
Combos can be performed even after the ice block hits the ground.
A version creates 3 spikes across half the screen (best at 1/4 screen distance).
B version creates 5 spikes across the entire screen (max 3 can hit).
C version creates 6 spikes across the entire screen (max 4 can hit at 1/4 screen).

variations.notes: Creates 3 ice spikes across half the screen. The best distance to get all 3 spikes to hit is about 1/4 of the screen. Frozen opponent can be comboed even after hitting the ground.
Creates 5 ice spikes across the entire screen. Maximum of 3 spikes can hit at once. Allows for combos even after the ice block hits the ground.
Creates 6 ice spikes across the entire screen. Maximum of 4 spikes can hit at once (at 1/4 screen distance). Actually plus on block unlike other versions.

properties: Shiori generates a column of freezing winds that surrounds her on both sides.
All versions freeze the opponent on hit and cannot be air-blocked.
The move randomly attacks when opponents are in range with different hit patterns.
A version extends about half screen high with consistently 5 hits.
B version extends about 1.5 screens high (can't be jumped over) with 8-15 random hits.
C version has the same height as B but with 12-18 random hits and longer recovery.

variations.notes: Creates a wind column about half screen high around Shiori. Consistently hits 5 times at point-blank range. Freezes opponent on hit and can't be air-blocked.
Wind column extends about 1.5 screens high (higher than any character can double jump). Hits randomly vary between 8-15 times even at point-blank range.
Similar to B version but with more hits (12-18 random hits) and longer active/recovery time. Highest damage potential but most punishable on block.

properties: Shiori poses with her hand out forwards, then generates a large horizontal tornado of wind. If it hits the opponent, Shiori will toss the frozen opponent into the air, and then uppercut straight through the opponent, ice and all, as it falls. Additionally, if the opponent blocks the tornado on the ground, the move will chip an incredible 2800 damage off, disregarding all forms of damage and defense multipliers.
This move can be quite an effective tool to remove the last 1/3 of the opponent's life, which usually takes a long time due to the Guts damage multiplier.
Most normals can be whiff cancelled into this move.
This move's input is NOT 236236B+C, B and C must be pressed in sequence rather than simultaneously.
